titleInfo.title: Letter no.13 of 1854 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the Imam of Muscat Syed Soweynee’s [Thuwaynī bin Sa‘id] plans to introduce a levy on British subjects (specifically, Hindus from India) in his port. Kemball reports that the amicable arrangements reached at Sohar between His Highness and the Wahhābī commander ‘Abdullāh bin Fayṣal have led to plans for the levy being abandoned. Kemball makes mention of a similar scheme, brought to his attention by the Native Agent at Sharjah; a capitation tax, levied in that town against non-Muslims, which amounted to five or six rupees per person per annum, and which gave non-Muslims immunity against military service and other ‘feudal obligation’. Kemball requests the Government’s views on the scheme.
